filesystem
Class FileSystemItem

java.lang.Object
  filesystem.FileSystemItem
Direct Known Subclasses:
Directory, File
public abstract class FileSystemItem
extends java.lang.Object

This class abstracts File and Directory.
Composite-Pattern: Component

Responsibilities:

  • declares the common interface for objects in the composition. This is:
    - get/setName(), toString()
    - getPath()
    - isDirectory()
    - getNumberOfFiles(), getNumberOfDirectories()
    - getSize()
  • implements default behavior for the interface common to all classes, as appropriate.
  • declares an interface for accessing and managing its child components. This is
    - getContent()
  • defines an interface for accessing a component's parent in the recursive structure, and implements it if that's appropriate. This is
    - getParent()

    FileSystemItem

                         Directory parent)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

    Method Detail

    getName

    public java.lang.String getName()
    Returns the name of the item. Only returns the name, not the path. The path must be obtained by getPath.

    Returns:
    Name of item - file name if isDirectory() == false - directory name if isDirectory()

    setName

    public void setName(java.lang.String newName)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
    Sets the name of the item.

    Parameters:
    newName - new name of the item. May not contain any ':', '/', ',', ' ' or '\' in the name. Otherwise, the name is not changed and an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
    Throws:
    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

    checkName

    protected boolean checkName(java.lang.String name)
    Checks whether a file or directory name contains illegal characters.

    Parameters:
    name - Name to check
    Returns:
    - true name is valid - false name contains at least one illegal character.

    getPath

    public java.lang.String getPath()
    Returns the full path of the item

    Returns:
    Full path, e.g. "C:\thisdir\thatdir\file.txt"

    toString

    public java.lang.String toString()
    Returns the full path of the item See getPath()

    Overrides:
    toString in class java.lang.Object

    getContent

    public abstract java.util.ArrayList<FileSystemItem> getContent()
    Returns the content of the item.

    Returns:
    - the list of contained files and directories if isDirectory() - null if isDirectory() == false

    getParent

    public Directory getParent()
    Returns the parent directory. If this item is the root directory (the top most directory), null is returned.

    Returns:
    Parent directory or null if this item is already the top most directory.

    setParent

    protected void setParent(Directory parent)
    Changes the parent; only accessible for subclasses. Use Directory.add() otherwise

    Parameters:
    parent - new parent directory. No checks are made if parent belongs to drive or if it is null

    isDirectory

    public abstract boolean isDirectory()
    Returns whether this item is a directory or not

    Returns:
    - true this item is a directory - false this item is not a directory

    getNumberOfFiles

    public abstract int getNumberOfFiles()
    Returns the number of files contained by this item

    Returns:
    number of contained files if isDirectory() 0 if isDirectory() == false

    getNumberOfDirectories

    public abstract int getNumberOfDirectories()
    Returns the number of directories contained by this item

    Returns:
    number of contained directories if isDirectory() 0 if isDirectory() == false

    getSize

    public abstract int getSize()
    Returns the size of the item

    Returns:
    the size in bytes of the file (string length of the content) if isDirectory() == false 0 if isDirectory()
